content:
further. The idea is that small objects will not need to have their
individual components culled separately, but large environments should.
This allows the user to specify what should be considered "small". Set
it to 0.0 to disable this feature. egg-ignore-decals bool 0 egg-ignore-filters bool 0 egg-ignore-mipmaps bool 0 egg-implicit-alpha-binary bool 0 If this is true, then a <Scalar> alpha value appearing in an
egg file that appears to specify only a binary (0 or 1) value for alpha
will automatically be downgraded to alpha type "binary" instead of
whatever appears in the egg file. egg-load-classic-nurbs-curves bool 0 When this is true (and the above is also true), a <NurbsCurve>
entry appearing in an egg file will load a ClassicNurbsCurve object
instead of the default, a NurbsCurve object. This only makes a
difference when the NURBS++ library is available, in which case the
